intro: Taraxacum subpallescens, commonly known as the pale chicharrón dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, this plant thrives in dry, disturbed soils and open habitats. The leaves are typically shorter and more densely pubescent compared to other dandelion species. It produces a distinctive, hollow stem with a milky sap that is characteristic of the genus Taraxacum.
